qas.question: What did other Arab leaders have to do to gain admiration of their populations?
What did Nasser cause in the wider Arab world?
What have other Arab leaders been unable to do that Nasser was?

answers.text: communicated directly with the public masses

context: Through his actions and speeches, and because he was able to symbolize <a3_0>the popular Arab will<a3_0/>, Nasser inspired <a1_0>several nationalist revolutions<a1_0/> in the Arab world. He defined the politics of his generation and <a2_0>communicated directly with the public masses<a2_0/> of the Arab world, bypassing the various heads of states of those countries—an accomplishment not repeated by other Arab leaders. The extent of Nasser's centrality in the region made it a priority for incoming Arab nationalist heads of state to <a0_0>seek good relations with Egypt<a0_0/>, in order to gain popular legitimacy from their own citizens.
